DataElement.preferredName: Hepatitis B Surface Antigen Test Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status of the participant's Hepatitis B surface antigen test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis B Surface Antigen Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, for the hepatitis B surface antigen, any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition:
Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface
of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles.
Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were
formerly called the Australia antigen.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen
Concepts.definition: Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the status serological hematology test.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not putting an end to doubt or question; leading to no final results or outcome.

Concepts.definition: Not putting an end to doubt or question; leading to no final results or outcome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
